abstract: South Carolina will hold its Republican presidential primary on Jan. 21, virtually assuring that voting in caucuses and primaries will begin just after New Year's Day.
snippet: South Carolina will hold its Republican presidential primary on Jan. 21, virtually assuring that voting in caucuses and primaries will begin just after New Year's Day.
lead_paragraph: South Carolina will hold its Republican presidential primary on Jan. 21, the party announced on Monday morning, virtually assuring that voting in caucuses and primaries will begin just after New Year's Day.

headline.main: South Carolina Picks Date for G.O.P. Primary
